alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Douglas; Iron; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT SOUTHERN BAYFIELD... SOUTHEASTERN DOUGLAS...NORTHWESTERN IRON...WASHBURN...ASHLAND AND SAWYER COUNTIES... At 942 AM CDT, a band of heavy snow showers were along a line extending from Ashland, to near Town of Delta, to 8 miles east of Wascott, and moving southwest at 25 mph. Visibilities of 1/4 mile or less and rapid snow accumulation on roads are expected with this area of heavy snow showers. Accumulations up to 1 inch of snow per hour will be possible within this band. This area of heavy snow showers will be near... Ashland, Sanborn, Drummond and Benoit around 950 AM CDT. Cable around 1005 AM CDT. Trego around 1010 AM CDT. Spooner around 1025 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this area of heavy snow showers include Reserve, Spooner Lake, Northwoods Beach, Bad River Reservation, Edgewater, Springbrook, Deer Lake, Little Sissabagama Lake, Ojibwa and Cedar. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Be prepared for changing visibility and road conditions. Reduce your speed and allow more space between you and the vehicle in front of you.

area.areaDesc: Ashland; Bayfield; Douglas; Iron; Sawyer; Washburn
